title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Power Projects, through 3E Consulting, LLC

description.narrative: This $95,796 definitional mission (DM) is identifying and evaluating opportunities in the energy and power sector in Burma for USTDA funding consideration. The DM contractor is focusing on the evaluation of the Ministry of Electric Powers investment plans and projects, particularly electricity transmission and distribution, gas-fired power, oil and gas exploration, and upgrading pipelines. USTDA funding support aims to open opportunities for U.S. technology and service providers to compete in this new market.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Civil Aviation Modernization, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: This reverse trade mission brought Burmese delegates from the civil aviation sector to the United States to gain exposure to advanced U.S. technologies and safety best practices. The delegates visited and met with U.S. aviation authorities, facilities, and product and service providers, including those offering technology options for aircrafts, aircraft maintenance, and airport services.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Energy Sector Modernization, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This reverse trade mission brought Burmese delegates from the energy sector to the United States to highlight U.S. technology and service capabilities for the construction, operation, maintenance, and refurbishment of gas-fired power plants. The delegates met with U.S. regulators, policy makers, private sector technology and service providers, and financiers that support the development of the gas and power industry.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
